availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Teal (Bath County, Kentucky, grocery keeper.)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer, constable, and grocery keeper. Kentucky native. Married to Barbary Shropshire Teal in Bath County in February 1848. Father of Melvina Teal, Henry Teal, Charles Teal, Mary Teal, Mariah Teal, Samuel Teal, Margaret Teal, and Susan Teal. Farmer and constable in Bath County in 1850. Employed Samuel Teal as a laborer in 1850. Grocery keeper in Bath County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 2, p. 23B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 5.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bath County Marriages, Film #000273005, p. 298 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "John Teal (1814-1876)," Memorial #172453348, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/172453348/john-teal (accessed July 24, 2020).
